noun.description: A feeling of revulsion or strong disapproval aroused by something unpleasant or offensive.
examples: the sight filled her with disgust
some of the audience walked out in disgust

verb.description: Cause (someone) to feel revulsion or profound disapproval.
examples: I was disgusted with myself for causing so much misery

origin: Late 16th century: from early modern French desgoust or Italian disgusto, from Latin dis- (expressing reversal) + gustus taste.
